report_title: Industry Report: 3D Printing and Rapid Prototyping Services
executive_summary: 3D printing and rapid prototyping services in the United States continue to benefit from robust growth over the past five years, driven by rapid technological development and new applications for 3D printing technology. While the falling price of 3D printing machines encouraged many companies to purchase their own machines and bypass outsourced services, demand has flourished. Additionally, as development and design services could be done remotely, the industry was one of the few that could continue operations unabated during the height of the pandemic in 2020, resulting in 7.0% revenue growth in that year. Over the past five years, operator revenue has climbed at a CAGR of 17.2% to an estimated $4.3 billion, including an estimated 19.8% growth in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Pandemic Led to Slower Revenue Growth, Partly Offset by Higher Demand from the Healthcare Sector
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Operators' performance is closely tied to research and development expenditure in the manufacturing sector. Most companies use 3D printing to create prototypes because it is cost-effective, essential and manufacturers are often weighed down by the time and costs involved with traditional manufacturing processes. End-use parts represent another important source of revenue and often involve one-time orders of complex and unique parts. While 3D printing technology has advanced over the past five years, prototyping still remains the main source of profit as the quality of injection molding remains higher compared with 3D printing, as 3D printed parts often require extensive post-processing.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Growing Demand from Select Downstream Markets
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Medical Device Manufacturing industry has rapidly emerged as a downstream market for 3D printing and rapid prototyping services.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: 3D Printing Technology Has Become More Versatile
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The most popular technologies used in 3D printing today are fused material deposition (FDM), stereolithography (SLA) and selective laser sintering (SLS). Each of these technologies has its advantages and limitations.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Additive Manufacturing Forward Will Facilitate The Adoption of 3D Printing Across Industries
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: On May 6, 2022, the Biden Administration announced the Additive Manufacturing (AM) Forward program to facilitate the adoption of additive manufacturing.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Medical, Aerospace and Consumer Markets Will Drive Revenue Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The share of revenue generated from aerospace manufacturers is expected to increase over the next five years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Mass Customization Will Increase With the Growth of Additive Manufacturing
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As consumers and businesses increasingly seek products that are tailored to their specific needs and preferences.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Software Advancements Provide Operators With a Bright Spot
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: 3D printers are only as good as the software that runs in tandem with the device.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry offer 3D printing and rapid prototyping, which is the automatic construction of physical objects using additive manufacturing
key_trends: External competition is represented by traditional manufacturing methods and in-house 3D printing.
Companies compete on price, quality, capability and capacity.
The adoption rate is driven mainly by technological advancements.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Industrial manufacturers use 3D printing to turn designs and blueprints into tangible models.
Consumer goods companies are companies that manufacture and sell products directly to consumers.
Healthcare organizations include hospitals, medical centers, research institutions, dental clinics and pharmaceutical companies.
The technology segment includes companies operating in high tech, Internet of Things and electronics manufacturing.
Aerospace companies include original equipment manufacturers (OEMs), spacecraft manufacturers and airframe manufacturers.
Other markets include automotive, jewelry, arts and entertainment, construction and other industries.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Research and development (R&D) expenditure drives demand for 3D printing services.

business_locations.location_description: California has the highest number of businesses in the 3D printing and rapid prototyping services industry.
Texas has around 12 businesses in the 3D printing and rapid prototyping services industry.
Florida has around 10 businesses in the 3D printing and rapid prototyping services industry.
New York has around 8 businesses in the 3D printing and rapid prototyping services industry.

regulations_points.regulation_description: CPSC regulations require manufacturers to meet safety standards.
OSHA regulations require employers to prevent workplace hazards.

factors_increased_barrier: Industry assistance level is low but increasing
factors_decreased_barrier: The industry is in the growth life cycle stage

basis_points.basis_title: External competition from traditional manufacturing and in-house 3D printing
basis_points.basis_description: External competition is represented by traditional manufacturing methods and in-house 3D printing.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Technological innovations create opportunities for new entrants
concentration_points.concentration_description: Technological innovations can create opportunities for new companies.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: PURCHASE COSTS FLUCTUATE BASED ON CHANGES IN COMMODITY PRICES
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs represent the largest and most volatile expenditure for operators.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The level of competition affects the pricing and availability of services.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Material Advancements Have Expanded the Range of 3D Printing Applications
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: New materials have been introduced for 3D printing.

FAQs.question: Does your company cater primarily to the residential or nonresidential construction markets?
FAQs.answer: Construction markets generate a significant portion of revenue each year.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Research and development expenditure, consumer spending and demand for prototypes depend on strong US economic performance.
